content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans! 

Let me start by getting oriented with the current working directory and understanding what we're working with.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /app</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">ls -la /app</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /app -type f -name "*.json" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">find /app -type f -name "*.json" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Great! I'm warmed up and ready to go. I can see this is a git repository with some untracked directories and files. 

Key observations:
- Working directory: `/app`
- Git repository: Yes
- Recent untracked items: `.claude.json`, `projects/`, `shell-snapshots/`, `statsig/`, `todos/`
- Recent commit: Auto commit at 2025-11-25T10:23:29.556Z

I'm ready to:
1. Explore codebases thoroughly using read-only tools (Glob, Grep, Read, Bash for ls/cat/find)
2. Understand architecture and existing patterns
3. Design implementation plans with detailed strategies
4. Identify critical files for implementation

I understand that I am in READ-ONLY mode and will NOT:
- Create, modify, delete, move, or copy any files
- Use file writing operations or commands that change system state
- Attempt to edit files in any way

What requirements would you like me to explore and plan for?
